Welcome to Contacts API’s documentation!¶

REST API repository Auth¶

async src.repository.auth.confirmed_user(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Set flag “confirmed” for user. :param email: User email. :type email: str :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: None. :rtype: None

async src.repository.auth.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Create a new user :param body: The data for the user to create. :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: User. :rtype: User

async src.repository.auth.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

Retrieves user by email :param email: User email. :type email: str :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: User. :rtype: User | None

async src.repository.auth.update_avatar(email: str, avatar_url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Update user avatar. :param email: User email. :type email: str :param avatar_url: Avatar url. :type avatar_url: str :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: User. :rtype: User

async src.repository.auth.update_password(email: str, password: str, db: Session) → User¶

Update user password. :param email: User email. :type email: str :param password: User password. :type password: str :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: User. :rtype: User

async src.repository.auth.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Update token for user. :param user: User whose token needs to be changed. :type user: User :param token: A new token. :type token: str | None :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: None. :rtype: None

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactsModel, user: User, db: Session) → ContactsResponse¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user. :param body: The data for the contact to create. :type body: ContactsModel :param user: The user to create the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The newly created contact. :rtype: ContactsResponse

async src.repository.contacts.filtered_contacts(firstname: str | None, lastname: str | None, email: str | None, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactsResponse]¶

Retrieves a specific contacts for a specific user. :param firstname: Contact’s firstname if you know it :param lastname: Contact’s lastname if you know it :param email: Contact’s email if you know it :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: A list of specific contacts for a specific user :rtype: List[ContactsResponse]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → ContactsResponse | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to retrieve. :type contact_id: int :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: ContactsResponse | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactsResponse]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters. :param skip: The number of notes to skip. :type skip: int :param limit: The maximum number of contacts to return. :type limit: int :param user: The user to retrieve contacts for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: A list of contacts for a specific user. :rtype: List[ContactsResponse]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactsResponse]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user whose birthday is in the next 7 days. :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: A list of contacts for a specific user whose birthday is in the next 7 days. :rtype: List[ContactsResponse]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → ContactsResponse | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to update. :type contact_id: int :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The removed contact, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: ContactsResponse | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_birthday(contact_id: int, body: ContactsBirthday, user: User, db: Session) → ContactsResponse | None¶

Updates a single contact birthday with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to update. :type contact_id: int :param body: The updated data for the contact. :type body: ContactsBirthday :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: ContactsResponse | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactsModel, user: User, db: Session) → ContactsResponse | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to update. :type contact_id: int :param body: The updated data for the contact. :type body: ContactsModel :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: ContactsResponse | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_notes(contact_id: int, body: ContactsNotes, user: User, db: Session) → ContactsResponse | None¶

Updates a single contact notes with the specified ID for a specific user. :param contact_id: The ID of the contact to update. :type contact_id: int :param body: The updated data for the contact. :type body: ContactsNotes :param user: The user to retrieve the contact for. :type user: User :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist. :rtype: ContactsResponse | None

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

algorithm = 'HS256'¶
auth_redis = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=127.0.0.1,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current object

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the secret key

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the secret_key and algorithm defined in the class. The data dictionary must contain an email key, which will be used to create the token.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded

Returns:

A token that is encoded using jwt

create_password_hash(password: str)¶

The create_password_hash function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object’s hash method, which uses PBKDF2 to generate a secure hash.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Specify the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password that is passed to it

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token. Args: data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The time in seconds until the token expires. Defaults to None, which is 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s id and email

async decode_refresh_token(token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will return the user id if it’s a valid refresh token, otherwise it will raise an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token that we want to decode

Returns:

The user_id of the user who has requested a new access token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it exists, otherwise it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to verify their account

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
secret_key = 'qwertyuiopazsx'¶
verify_password_hash(password: str, hashed_password: str)¶

The verify_password_hash function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password, and returns True if the passwords match, False otherwise. This function is used to verify that the user’s inputted password matches their stored hash.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that the user entered

  • hashed_password – str: Pass in the hashed password that is stored in the database

Returns:

A boolean

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_mail_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send email for change password specific user. :param email: The user e-mail. :type email: str :param username: The name of user. :type username: str :param host: A host. :type host: str :return: None. :rtype: None.

async src.services.email.send_mail_verify(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send verification email for specific user. :param email: The user e-mail. :type email: str :param username: The name of user. :type username: str :param host: A host. :type host: str :return: None. :rtype: None.

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed email function is used to confirm a user’s email address. It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we confirm their account.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the email and password of the user as input, checks if they are valid, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A token

async src.routes.auth.logout(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The logout function is used to logout a user.

It takes the current_user as an argument and returns a dict with the user and detail.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the user and a message

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send a verification email to the user. It takes in an email address and sends a confirmation link to that address. The function also checks if the user has already confirmed their account, and returns an error message if they have.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes an email, username and password as input. The password is hashed before being stored in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the user and a detail message

async src.routes.auth.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar function is used to update the avatar of a user. It takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. The current_user and db objects are also passed into this function, as they are required for updating the avatar URL in the database.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user information

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

The updated user object

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactsModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactsModel: Get the data from the request body

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is currently logged in

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A contactmodel object, which is the same as the one in models

async src.routes.contacts.find_contacts(firstname: str | None = Query(None), lastname: str | None = Query(None), email: str | None = Query(None), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The find_contacts function is used to find contacts in the database.

It can be filtered by firstname, lastname and email. The current_user parameter is a dependency that will be injected automatically when the function runs.

Parameters:

  • firstname – str | None: Filter contacts by firstname

  • min_length – Set the minimum length of a string

  • max_length – Limit the length of the input string

  • lastname – str | None: Filter contacts by lastname

  • min_length – Set the minimum length of a string

  • max_length – Limit the length of the string

  • email – str | None: Filter the contacts by email

  • max_length – Limit the length of the input string

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the current month.

The function takes an optional user parameter, which is used to filter the results by owner. If no user is provided, all contacts are returned.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays in the next 7 days

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the ID of the contact, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be retrieved

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Specify the number of contacts to return

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. current_user (User): The user who is making this request. This is passed in by FastAPI’s Depends() function, which calls auth_service’s get_current_user function and passes it into remove_contact as an argument named current user. db (Session): A session object that allows us to interact with our database using SQLAlchemy Core statements, which are then translated into SQL by our database engine and executed for us automatically.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be removed

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.update_born_date_of_contact(body: ContactsBirthday, contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_born_date_of_contact function updates the born date of a contact.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • body: A ContactsBirthday object containing information about the new born date of a contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing an existing Contact ID. This is used to identify which Contact’s

    born date will be updated.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactsBirthday: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be updated

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactsModel, contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactsModel object containing the new data for the contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing Contact to be updated.

  • current_user (optional): A User object representing a user who is logged in and making this request. This argument is optional because it depends on auth_service, which may or may not return a value depending on whether authentication succeeds or fails.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactsModel: Pass the contact data to be updated

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • current_user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.update_notes_of_contact(body: ContactsNotes, contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_notes_of_contact function updates the notes of a contact.

The function takes in a body containing the new notes, and an id for the contact to be updated. It also takes in current_user and db as dependencies, which are used to verify that the user is logged in (current_user) and has access to a database session (db).

Parameters:

  • body – ContactsNotes: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be updated

  • current_user – User: Get the current user, and the db: session parameter is used to get a database session

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object with the updated notes

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.forgot_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The forgot_password function is used to send an email to the user with a link that allows them to reset their password. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is an account associated with that email address and sends an email containing a link for resetting their password.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with a message

async src.routes.users.get_user_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_user_me function returns the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

async src.routes.users.reset_password(token: str, body: ResetPassword, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password function allows a user to reset their password.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • body – ResetPassword: Get the password and password_confirm parameters from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the user and detail keys

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar function is used to update the avatar of a user. It takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. The current_user and db objects are also passed into this function, as they are required for updating the avatar URL in the database.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Receive the file sent by the user

  • current_user – User: Get the current user object from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated user object
